security: The document discusses NSA targeting priorities and capabilities, including specific targets like Cuban and Mexican diplomatic communications. It mentions the exploitation of Cuban cryptosystems and the collection of SIGINT product reports. Disclosing these details could reveal sensitive intelligence gathering methods and compromise current operations. Quoting directly: "Numerous Cuban cryptosystems were exploited during the early 1960s, including some Cuban military and illicit agent communications through depths or diagnosis and exploitation. NSA had an excellent capability to meet the SIGINT challenges of the 1960's."
summary: The NSA provides a response to the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) regarding its capabilities and records related to Cuba and Mexico during the period of 1963-1964, including targeting priorities, COMINT, and diplomatic communications.
summary_one_paragraph: In a letter dated April 1, 1998, the NSA, through Deputy Director of Policy Joann H. Grube, responds to the ARRB's questions regarding NSA targeting priorities and capabilities against Cuba and Mexico from 1963-1964. The NSA tasked elements to search for relevant information and reviewed USIB records, detailing SIGINT objectives to gather information on Soviet and Cuban military capabilities, internal warfare efforts, and political developments. The response indicates the NSA had capabilities to exploit Cuban cryptosystems and collected communications to and from Cuban embassies in various countries, while also targeting Mexican diplomatic communications, but found no records directly related to the JFK assassination beyond those already provided to the ARRB.
title: NSA Response to ARRRB Questions Re NSA Capabilities/Records
